body: Thanks for looking. I agree that those are going to need work.

issue.title: org.joda.time.TestDateTimeZone tests failed

repository.name: joda-time
repository.description: Joda-Time is the widely used replacement for the Java date and time classes prior to Java SE 8.

issue.body:
### Key information

- Joda-Time version
`2.10.10`
- Result of `TimeZone.getDefault()`
`sun.util.calendar.ZoneInfo[id="Asia/Jakarta",offset=25200000,dstSavings=0,useDaylight=false,transitions=9,lastRule=null]`
- Result of `DateTimeZone.getDefault()`
`Asia/Jakarta`

### Problem description
The tests don't seem to pass.
Both java LTS version have this failure. (see below)

### Test case
**Java 11**
```
$ java -version
openjdk version "11.0.12" 2021-07-20
OpenJDK Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11.0.12+7)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11.0.12+7, mixed mode, sharing)
$ javac -version
javac 11.0.12
....
```
